titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Greenpoint YMCA Congress Alumni scrapbooks 1977.130
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Greenpoint YMCA Congress Alumni scrapbooks, 1977.130, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Greenpoint YMCA was organized in 1885 and moved to a permanent building at 224-226 Manhattan Avenue in 1889. From 1894 to 1898, the Greenpoint YMCA organized a Congress where students, assigned to represent a state, received training in public speaking and civic issues. In 1905, former members of the Congress formed the Congress Alumni, which functioned as a civic and social group until 1956.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection includes two unbound scrapbooks of materials documenting the activities of the Greenpoint YMCA Congress Alumni during the period 1895 to 1958. Materials include tickets, photographs, news clippings, list of members, programs, and menus.
